meanings.definition: A flexible tube with an eyepiece on one end and a lens on the other, used for inspecting hard-to-reach areas.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used borescopes to look inside the engine and find the problem.
meanings.sent2: Borescopes are essential tools for examining narrow spaces in machinery.
meanings.sent3: During the treasure hunt, they jokingly used a borescope to peek into the locked chest.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was like a borescope, always searching for hidden secrets.
meanings.sent5: The detective's borescope revealed a tiny clue that cracked the case wide open.

meanings.definition: To use a borescope to visually inspect an object or area.
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully borescopes the pipeline to check for any leaks.
meanings.sent2: They will borescope the walls to ensure there are no structural issues.
meanings.sent3: He borescopes the fridge to investigate the mysterious disappearance of the last slice of cake.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp eyes borescope every detail, missing nothing in her surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The explorer borescopes the ancient ruins, uncovering hidden inscriptions.
